Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 (Net)&nbsp;/ Month.

Job Summary

	Manage projects, contracts, and operational tasks to ensure timely completion.

	Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities effectively.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketer",
  "description": "Kanselor Business Innovation Campus is into&nbsp;Business operation management, market storm promotion, recruitment, product lauch and sales inventory management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Aba - Abia and Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Marketer will be responsible for driving business growth by identifying new clients, maintaining existing relationships, and promoting the company&rsquo;s freight forwarding and logistics services.
	The role requires a proactive, target-driven individual with a strong understanding of shipping, logistics, and supply chain operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, prospect, and develop new business opportunities in freight forwarding (import/export, sea, air, and land).
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure repeat business and customer satisfaction.
	Prepare and deliver effective sales presentations and proposals tailored to client needs.
	Negotiate contracts, rates, and service agreements with clients in line with company policies.
	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitor activities, and potential clients.
	Collaborate with operations and documentation teams to ensure smooth execution of clients&rsquo; shipments.
	Achieve assigned sales targets and performance goals.
	Represent the company at industry events, exhibitions, and networking functions to promote services.
	Prepare weekly and monthly sales reports and provide feedback on market intelligence.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Logistics, or related field.
	2&ndash;3 years of experience in marketing or sales within the freight forwarding, shipping, or logistics industry.

Our goal is simple: help organizations grow by connecting them with the right people and building compliant, efficient HR systems. We serve startups, SMEs, and large enterprises looking to scale without the burden of in-house HR challenges.

Job Position: Electrical Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Maintenance / Engineering
Reports to: Maintenance Supervisor or Senior Electrical Engineer

Job Summary


	The Experienced Electrical Technician will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of electrical systems and equipment in a manufacturing or industrial environment.
	The ideal candidate will have extensive hands-on experience, strong diagnostic skills, and a solid understanding of industrial electrical components.
	This role requires adherence to safety standards, effective communication, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team to minimize operational downtime and maximize equipment reliability.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on all electrical equipment, machinery, and control systems within the plant.
	Diagnose and troubleshoot complex electrical issues, including problems with PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), VFDs (Variable Frequency Drives), sensors, and control loops.
	Install, test, and maintain electrical wiring, distribution panels, circuit breakers, transformers, electric motors, and other related components.
	Read and interpret complex electrical schematics, blueprints, and technical diagrams to guide repair and installation work.
	Ensure the reliable functioning of power distribution systems, including switchboards and control panels.
	Conduct all work in strict compliance with safety regulations, electrical codes, and company policies, including lockout/tagout procedures.
	Execute electrical tasks during shift operations and respond promptly to equipment breakdowns to restore operations.
	Maintain accurate and comprehensive records of all maintenance work, including daily reports, spare parts used, and machine downtime.
	Work collaboratively with other technicians (mechanical, instrumentation) to ensure effective and timely completion of maintenance tasks.
	Proactively identify and implement continuous improvement actions to address recurring issues and increase equipment efficiency and safety.
	Provide electrical support for project work, equipment overhauls, and factory improvements.


Required qualifications and skills


	Education: Higher National Diploma (HND) or Ordinary National Diploma (OND) in Electrical Engineering or a related technical field. A relevant Trade Test Certificate is also a plus.
	Experience: A minimum of 3 to 5 years of practical experience as an Electrical Technician in a manufacturing, FMCG (Fast-Moving Consumer Goods), or industrial environment.


Technical skills:


	Strong knowledge of industrial electrical systems, power distribution, and motor controls (AC/DC).
	Proficiency in troubleshooting electrical and automation issues using test equipment such as multimeters, ohmmeters, etc..
	Familiarity with Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) and industrial control systems.
	Solid understanding of safety procedures for electrical work.
	Soft skills:
	Excellent problem-solving and diagnostic skills.
	Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
	High level of attention to detail and ability to follow complex instructions.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure to meet production targets.
